description: Attaches the specified VPC to the specified transit gateway. If you attach a VPC with a CIDR range that overlaps the CIDR range of a VPC that is already attached, the new VPC CIDR range is not propagated to the default propagation route table. To send VPC traffic to an attached transit gateway, add a route to the VPC route table using  CreateRoute.

parameters.name: TransitGatewayId
parameters.description: The ID of the transit gateway.

parameters.name: SubnetIds
parameters.description: The IDs of one or more subnets. You can specify only one subnet per Availability Zone. You must specify at least one subnet, but we recommend that you specify two subnets for better availability. The transit gateway uses one IP address from each specified subnet. (string) ---

parameters.name: Options
parameters.description: The VPC attachment options. DnsSupport (string) --- Enable or disable DNS support. The default is enable. SecurityGroupReferencingSupport (string) --- Enables you to reference a security group across VPCs attached to a transit gateway to simplify security group management. This option is set to enable by default. However, at the transit gateway level the default is set to disable. For more information about security group referencing, see Security group referencing in the Amazon Web Services Transit Gateways Guide. Ipv6Support (string) --- Enable or disable IPv6 support. The default is disable. ApplianceModeSupport (string) --- Enable or disable support for appliance mode. If enabled, a traffic flow between a source and destination uses the same Availability Zone for the VPC attachment for the lifetime of that flow. The default is disable.

nested_params.name: DnsSupport
nested_params.description: Enable or disable DNS support. The default is enable.

nested_params.name: SecurityGroupReferencingSupport
nested_params.description: Enables you to reference a security group across VPCs attached to a transit gateway to simplify security group management. This option is set to enable by default. However, at the transit gateway level the default is set to disable. For more information about security group referencing, see Security group referencing in the Amazon Web Services Transit Gateways Guide.

nested_params.name: Ipv6Support
nested_params.description: Enable or disable IPv6 support. The default is disable.

nested_params.name: ApplianceModeSupport
nested_params.description: Enable or disable support for appliance mode. If enabled, a traffic flow between a source and destination uses the same Availability Zone for the VPC attachment for the lifetime of that flow. The default is disable.

parameters.name: TagSpecifications
parameters.description: The tags to apply to the VPC attachment. (dict) --- The tags to apply to a resource when the resource is being created. When you specify a tag, you must specify the resource type to tag, otherwise the request will fail. ResourceType (string) --- The type of resource to tag on creation. Tags (list) --- The tags to apply to the resource. (dict) --- Describes a tag. Key (string) --- The key of the tag. Constraints: Tag keys are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 127 Unicode characters. May not begin with aws:. Value (string) --- The value of the tag. Constraints: Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 256 Unicode characters.

nested_params.name: ResourceType
nested_params.description: The type of resource to tag on creation.

nested_params.name: Tags
nested_params.description: The tags to apply to the resource.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The key of the tag. Constraints: Tag keys are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 127 Unicode characters. May not begin with aws:.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The value of the tag. Constraints: Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 256 Unicode characters.

nested_items.name: TransitGatewayId
nested_items.description: The ID of the transit gateway.

nested_items.name: VpcOwnerId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the VPC.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The state of the VPC attachment. Note that the initiating state has been deprecated.

nested_items.name: DnsSupport
nested_items.description: Indicates whether DNS support is enabled.
